about_the_game:
In this game you will face a set of enemies - inhabitants of the Wealdfall - on your journey to gather nutrients for your squirrel avatar. As a standardized squirrel you can not fight other animals - you have to use your supreme running and jumping skills to avoid them. Those however shall not be all the adversities you will have to overcome. Lands of the Wealdfall do not allow for a simple stroll. Your chances of survival shall also be thwarted by environmental hazards such as water reservoirs (since, as we all know, characters in platformer games usually can not swim) or low flying rocks (no comment, you'll have to see it). Show prowess in your squirrel ways and you may yet succeed.

                                                                  

After extensive testing the results showed that the squirrel used in game is a far-sighted species. Due to lack of availability of corrective glasses in squirrel sizes things closer to the squirrel may appear of lower quality than everything located further away (in other words: Game has original graphics. It's a mix of pixel art and higher resolution graphics - levels and characters in game are created in pixel art while backgrounds use higher resolution art).

                                                                  

Wealdfall Squirrel is based on old 2D platformer games. It has simple controls and linear playthrough. It allows players to set their own difficulty based on what they want (within what options sliders actually allow for of course). If you want every point to translate to extra life - set correct slider in the options and voila, no need to worry about your little squirrel mob to run out of recruits. Don't want to bother with gathering points necessary to finish a level? - a quick change and your squirrels will go hungry for all the work they'll do. Tired of listening to the game sounds? - one swift motion and all the squeaks go away.
For clarity - difficulty options that player can change are: amount of lives at start; points needed to gain extra life; amount of points needed to be able to finish level; amount of checkpoints in a level.

                                                                  

Be advised. Text above is a satirical content. For actual information about squirrels search in different sources.
detailed_description:
In this game you will face a set of enemies - inhabitants of the Wealdfall - on your journey to gather nutrients for your squirrel avatar. As a standardized squirrel you can not fight other animals - you have to use your supreme running and jumping skills to avoid them. Those however shall not be all the adversities you will have to overcome. Lands of the Wealdfall do not allow for a simple stroll. Your chances of survival shall also be thwarted by environmental hazards such as water reservoirs (since, as we all know, characters in platformer games usually can not swim) or low flying rocks (no comment, you'll have to see it). Show prowess in your squirrel ways and you may yet succeed.

                                                                  

After extensive testing the results showed that the squirrel used in game is a far-sighted species. Due to lack of availability of corrective glasses in squirrel sizes things closer to the squirrel may appear of lower quality than everything located further away (in other words: Game has original graphics. It's a mix of pixel art and higher resolution graphics - levels and characters in game are created in pixel art while backgrounds use higher resolution art).

                                                                  

Wealdfall Squirrel is based on old 2D platformer games. It has simple controls and linear playthrough. It allows players to set their own difficulty based on what they want (within what options sliders actually allow for of course). If you want every point to translate to extra life - set correct slider in the options and voila, no need to worry about your little squirrel mob to run out of recruits. Don't want to bother with gathering points necessary to finish a level? - a quick change and your squirrels will go hungry for all the work they'll do. Tired of listening to the game sounds? - one swift motion and all the squeaks go away.
For clarity - difficulty options that player can change are: amount of lives at start; points needed to gain extra life; amount of points needed to be able to finish level; amount of checkpoints in a level.

                                                                  

Be advised. Text above is a satirical content. For actual information about squirrels search in different sources.
name: Wealdfall Squirrel

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-3320M
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 232 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-10400F
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 232 MB available space

short_description: Wealdfall Squirrel is a 2D platformer game that let's you take control of a squirrel on a quest to gather hazelnuts in the Wealdfall Forest and surrounding areas. Run, jump, avoid creatures of the wild and survive the Wealdfall.
supported_languages:
English*, Polish*, Traditional Chinese*, Japanese*, French*, Spanish - Spain*
*languages with full audio support
